Just bought some $WBTC on @KyberNetwork with 3 clicks. In 30 seconds for $0.10 transaction fee I got BTC exposure that is compatible with the entire ETH/ERC20 ecosystem. The network effects of the Ethereum are massively underestimated by some. $WTBC strengthens them even further.

Bitcoin Lightning Network: 613 BTC ($2.1M) network capacity, with 5.7k nodes  wBTC: 72 BTC ($247,000) minted at launch for the Bitcoin-pegged Ethereum token  Each have their trade offs, but I'm genuinely excited to see the growth potential and participate in both ecosystems

Maker would be incredible right now if Ether was $10T in market cap, massively liquid, and had greatly reduced volatility as a result  Dai could actually serve as a world currency in that case  But yes, tell me more about how Ethereum can be just as successful at $5 per Eth

When you stop & look, there are shockingly few coins that have a fully bootstrapped PoW network & are the primary coin for their algo.  Bitcoin Ethereum Litecoin Monero Zcash Doge (merge mined w/ Litecoin)  These are the only truly decentralized, secure chains. Missing any?

I want to go on record as saying this publicly: I love Ethereum, but ultimately I don't care who "wins" - @ethereum, @polkadotnetwork, or another legitimate project/community - as long as we reach the decentralized, permissionless, censorship resistant, usable web3 promised land.
I, for one, hope Ethereum wins and have no interest in its competitors having success.
